description: Internal and external alterations to the building in conjunction with the formation of a retail unit on each of the ground and first floors and rearrangement of the restaurant with hot food takeaway facilities on the south-west corner and alterations to the pedestrian access to the building, roof top parking and servicing arrangements, plant and canopy over loading area
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 816_01_07:_050 01, _051 01, _052 01, _053 01, _100 01, _101 01, _102 02, _103 01, _201 02, _202 02, _203 01, _204 01, _205 01, _206 01, _207 01, _208 01, _209 01, _400 01, _401 02, _402 02, _403 01, _404 01, 816_01_09_231 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with detailed drawings to a scale of not less than 1:10, which shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details shall show sections and cross-sections of doors, windows, shop fronts and all elevations.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the quality indicated in the application drawings and does not prejudice the appearance of the locality, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6, 4.8 & 4.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 & 7.8 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of the materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.6 & 4.8 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4, 7.5, 7.6 & 7.8 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of refuse and recycling storage facilities and a refuse and recycling management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The details as approved shall be installed at the site prior to the first use of the development, and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, to protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety all in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, & 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 5.16, 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | A delivery/servicing management plan including vehicle swepth path diagrams shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first use of the development. The area shown on the approved plans as a servicing area shall be kept clear at all times and shall be used for servicing only. The development shall be implemented and operated only in accordance with the approved details, and the approved arrangements shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, & 7B of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No more than 778sqm of the gross internal floor space within the building shall be in Class A3/A5 use. The remaining 8,819sqm of gross internal floorspace within the building shall be in Class A1 retail use.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the A1 retail character of this Primary Shopping Frontage, in accordance with policies 7.1, 7.3 & 7.6 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, & 2.5 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 2.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No development shall take place, including any works of demolition until a Construction Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such Plan shall include:  i). Construction worker parking ii). Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles. iii). Delivery times iv). Dust suppression measures v). Site security vi). Vehicle manoeuvring and turning vii). Locations for the storage of building materials and construction debris and contractors offices viii). Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents, ix) details of dust mitigationx) Details of scaffolding and hoardings (including vehicle sight lines), the position of any proposed gantry, storage and designated waiting areas. Such details shall be implemented, or phasing agreed in writing, prior to the commencement of works on site and thereafter retained for the duration of the works.  Reason: To protect the amenities of local residents and businesses and the safety of road  users in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.11, 9.1, 9.9 & 9.10 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.3, 6.14, & 7.13 - 7.14 of the London Plan (2011), the National Planning Policy Framework (2012), Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for Noise & Vibration Control on Construction & Open Sites-Part 1: Noise. | The hours of use by customer vehicles of the parking facilities hereby approved, including the access road and ramp, shall exclude the hours between 11.00pm  and 6.30am Monday-Saturday and before 10:00am and after 5:00pm on Sundays, save only for those exiting the facilities whereupon the access road and ramp can be used no later than 11.45pm Monday-Friday and 5.45pm on Sundays. The hours of use by vehicles servicing the facilities hereby approved, including the access road and ramp, shall exclude the hours between 11:00pm and 6:00am daily.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of occupiers of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4, 4.11 & 5.5 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No deliveries or unloading of goods or materials or collection of refuse or waste shall take from anywhere other than within the confines of the site. No deliveries or collections shall occur on the public highway. No delivery vehicles shall wait on Spring Bridge Road or The Broadway.  Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area and the free flow and safety of vehicular and pedestrian movements in the vicinity of the site, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | There shall be no drive facility at the proposed A3/A5 unit at the site.     Reason: In the interests of the free flow and safety of traffic along the neighbouring highways and in the interests of the amenity of the area, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | There shall be no obstruction or impediment to prevent the provision of vehicular access from the existing access ramp at 1-8 The Broadway (Arcadia Centre) for future access to service adjoining land and premises adjacent to the site to the east, as shown on drawing numbered 816_01_09_231.   Reason: To ensure that the proposed development safeguards the potential for servicing adjoining land so as not to prejudice future development potential of the wider Arcadia Site, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | No refuse or waste material shall be left or stored anywhere on the site other than within the building or a refuse enclosure.  Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the building and amenities of the area. accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Before any of the re-configured retail units are permanently occupied, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, the parking and service areas and turning space indicated on the approved drawings shall be available for use and permanently retained.  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic, the conditions of general safety along the neighbouring highway and the amenities of the area, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The disabled parking spaces and family parking spaces indicated on drawing No. 816_01_07_102 02 shall be clearly marked out on site at all times and shall be not be used other than for the purposes specified on the drawing. The disabled spaces must be at least 3.6m wide and the regular bays at least 2.4m wide.  Reason: To ensure adequate parking provision for disabled persons and mothers and children, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town & Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, (or any Order revoking or re-enacting that Order) no telecommunications equipment shall be erected on the building.  Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the conservation area and the amenity of the area, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.8, 4.11, 5.5 & 9.1 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the details already submitted, further details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, to demonstrate that the rating noise level emitted from the proposed external plant and machinery at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Prior to the permanent occupation of the reconfigured retail units, the plant shall be isolated from the structure with suitable approved anti-vibration isolators.  Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Before any of the re-configured retail units are permanently occupied, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme for external lighting of the building including the `lantern` feature on south-west corner of the building shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the lighting is in keeping with character and appearance of the area and the amenities of the  locality are adequately safeguarded, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 10, policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and policies 7.14 & 7.15 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is occupied, to demonstrate that the lighting scheme will comply with the recommendations made by the Institute of Lighting Engineers Technical Report, "Guidance Notes on the Reduction of Light Pollution" and also the provisions at the relevant parts of BS 5489.  Reason: To protect the amenity of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 7A of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details shall be submitted for the approval of the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the installation, operation, and maintenance of the best practicable cooking extract system, including the provision of a suitable extract fan, odour control equipment, and a satisfactory discharge height, including a vertical discharge without any cap or cover.  Reason: to protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1, 1.2, 2.1 & 2.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies LV 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Draft Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 4.5, & 7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
